meaningMnemonic: Put your <radical>fingers</radical> to your <radical>forehead</radical> and stand your <radical>legs</radical> high up in a <radical>tree</radical> if you want to <kanji>look for</kanji> something. After all, shielding your eyes and getting up high is the best way to look for something, isn’t it?
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>look for</kanji> it for so long that you can't help getting a <reading>tan</reading> (たん). I mean, you're up some tree, shielding your eyes from the sun as you look for that thing, and it's been hours, days? Of course you're going to get a tan.
